Lovely comuna 13 neighbourhood in Medellin, Colombia. 
Years ago it was used to be one of the most dangerous barrios of Pablo Escobars hometown! It's transforming for the better. These orange structures you can see cover the urban escalators built into the hillside. A strenuous walk uphill was turned into an easy 5 minute ride! Art, music, hope and the love of the people changes everything here. â¤

BTW: comuna 13 offers one of the best streetart in Southamerica. ð¡ð¨ #comuna13 #medellin #antioquia #colombia #southamerica #streetart #history #escalas #community #graffiti #hope #love #travelgram #simplifyyourself

Yesterday we went for a coastal hike from Sayulita to San Pancho. It was a so much of sun exposure that just drained our energy. Little did we know there was a private property right before San Pancho. There was no way they will allow us to pass through. 
So we tried hiking up through the dry river into the jungle to find another way out. We were out of water and hungry. There was a second thought of turning back to Sayulita because we had no idea where the river will lead us to, but it was a long way. It was really challenging our mind and body. However, that intense feeling of relief and happiness rised the next second we say this sign.

Lovely comuna 13 neighbourhood in Medellin, Colombia.

These orange structures you can see cover the urban escalators built into the hillside. A strenuous walk uphill was turned into an easy 5 minute ride! Art, music, hope and the love of the people changes everything here. â¤

Yesterday we went for a coastal hike from Sayulita to San Pancho. It was a so much of sun exposure that just drained our energy. Little did we know there was a private property right before San Pancho. There was no way they will allow us to pass through. 
So we tried hiking up through the dry river into the jungle to find another way out. We were out of water and hungry. There was a second thought of turning back to Sayulita because we had no idea where the river will lead us to, but it was a long way. It was really challenging our mind and body. However, that intense feeling of relief and happiness rised the next second we say this sign. 
To me, and I think to these two guys also, this was a special experience who are from three different continents, searching for a mini adventure. Thanks guys! ðâï¸#travelbuddies

Lovely comuna 13 neighbourhood in Medellin, Colombia. 
Years ago it was used to be one of the most dangerous barrios of Pablo Escobars hometown! It's transforming for the better. These orange structures you can see cover the urban escalators built into the hillside. A strenuous walk uphill was turned into an easy 5 minute ride! Art, music, hope and the love of the people changes everything here. â¤

Yesterday we went for a coastal hike from Sayulita to San Pancho. It was a so much of sun exposure that just drained our energy. Little did we know there was a private property right before San Pancho. There was no way they will allow us to pass through. 
So we tried hiking up through the dry river into the jungle to find another way out. We were out of water and hungry. There was a second thought of turning back to Sayulita because we had no idea where the river will lead us to, but it was a long way. It was really challenging our mind and body. However, that intense feeling of relief and happiness rised the next second we say this sign.
